intro: Memecylon hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan memecylon, is a flowering plant species native to the Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
